comments.raw_text:
On mac, when a keyboard shortcut is activated, we flash the menu which has that keyboard shortcut set on one of its item, if any. For example, we flash the File Menu, when Cmd+W is activated.

This is all fine, but there's a bug in the way: if File > Close was removed, usually by a script, the File menu would still flash when Cmd+W is activated. Once the user opens the file menu, the menu is rebuilt (in a strong-enough way... nsIStandaloneNativeMenu.menuWillOpen doesn't do the trick, another report is on the way), and activating Cmd+W will no longer highlight the File menu.
